item.title: East Asian Network For The Academic Study Of Esotericism (EANASE)
Rejected Religion
item.description: Introduction What is meant by “rejected” in Rejected Religion? Put simply, it’s everything that has been considered ‘heretical’ or ‘forbidden’ by the dominant religions throughout Western history. Think of terms such as ‘the occult’ or ‘the esoteric’ and all that can be located in that area - magical practices such as witchcraft; alternate worldviews such as Satanism; systems such as astrology and tarot; the use of hallucinogenic substances for ‘spiritual’ growth; or well-known people such as Aleister Crowley – this is just a small sample of the larger ‘esoteric’ category that this platform addresses.
